channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Judge orders release of Columbia activist Mahmoud Khalil
item.description: Khalil will be released on bail while his case challenging his deportation orders plays out in the courts.

item.title: A cancer center in Jordan treats kids from Gaza, but only a few dozen have arrived
item.description: Children from Gaza with cancer are finally making it to Jordan for long-promised treatment. But a plan to allow as many as 2,000 patients out of the w...

item.title: Why is caregiving so hard in America? The answers emerge in a new film
item.description: A new documentary on PBS shows what it's like to care for adult family members and recounts the history of caregiving policy in the U.S., revealing wh...

item.title: What children in poverty could lose from the 'Big Beautiful Bill'
item.description: Republicans want to change or reduce key social safety net programs that provide health care, food benefits and financial assistance for millions of c...

item.title: Court backs Trump's control of National Guard. And, the latest on the Israel-Iran war
item.description: Trump can maintain control over California's National Guard troops in LA after a federal appeals court ruling. And, the president says he'll decide wh...

item.title: Hurricane Erick hits Mexico resort towns killing two
item.description: Video shows communities in the affected areas dealing with flood waters and a messy clean-up.

item.title: Iranian-American describes what family in Iran, U.S. is experiencing amid Israeli airstrikes
item.description: Alex Shams, the editor-in-chief of Ajam Media Collective, joins "CBS News 24/7" to describe what his family members in Tehran are experiencing amid th...

item.title: California argues in court against Trumpâ€™s National Guard deployment
Sean "Diddy" Combs' former assistant describes working for mogul in key testimony
item.description: Sean "Diddy" Combs' former assistant, Brendan Paul, testified Friday in the music mogul's sex trafficking and racketeering trial. He is expected to be...

item.title: Jihadists on 200 motorbikes storm Niger army base
item.description: At least 34 soldiers were killed in the latest attack by Islamist groups, Niger's military leaders say.

item.title: Israelis on edge as Iranian missile strikes continue
item.description: Air raid sirens blared across Israel as Iran launched more strikes Friday. Robert Murrett, a professor at Syracuse University, joins with more on how ...

item.title: Watch: Sunken British superyacht raised from seabed
item.description: The cause of the sinking, which killed seven of the 22 people onboard, is still under investigation.

item.title: Judge orders release of Columbia activist Mahmoud Khalil from ICE detention
item.description: A federal judge in New Jersey on Friday ordered that Columbia University activist Mahmoud Khalil must be released from detention.

item.title: Judge orders Columbia University protester Mahmoud Khalil freed from detention
item.description: A federal judge has ordered the U.S. government to free former Columbia University graduate student Mahmoud Khalil from immigration detention.

item.title: 'A choice of two evils': Young anti-regime Iranians divided over conflict
item.description: Anti-regime Iranians agree the Islamic Republic must fall, but differ on the Iran-Israel conflict and response.

item.title: Maps show forecast for looming heat wave
item.description: The National Weather Service called the forecast for above-average temperatures "the first significant heat wave this season."

item.title: Niger military leaders to nationalise uranium firm
item.description: The company is majority French-owned, while the junta wants more local control of Niger's mineral wealth.

item.title: Juneteenth celebrations across the US commemorate the end of slavery
